fiction.author: Victor Hugo
fiction.description: Thanks this novel, I am convinced that a single act of mercy can transform a human being into a force for good.

fiction.title: The Brothers Karamazov
fiction.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
fiction.description: A philosophical murder mystery that looks into the deepest questions of human existence - faith, doubt, and remorse.

fiction.title: Siddhartha
fiction.author: Hermann Hesse
fiction.description: A journey of self-discovery as a young Brahmin seeks enlightenment. Hesse offers a Western perspective on Eastern wisdom and the path to inner peace.

fiction.title: The Foundation Pit
fiction.author: Andrei Platonov
fiction.description: A Soviet-era allegory about workers digging a foundation for a utopian building that never materializes. I absolutely love how Platonov captures the absurdity of forced collectivism.

fiction.title: The Old Man and the Sea
fiction.author: Ernest Hemingway
fiction.description: A powerful tale of endurance and dignity that reminds me that a human being can lose but they can't be defeated.

fiction.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fiction.author: Harper Lee
fiction.description: A profound exploration of moral courage that showed me what it means to do right.

fiction.title: Cancer Ward
fiction.author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
fiction.description: Set in a Soviet hospital, patients from all walks of life confront disease and mortality. Solzhenitsyn transforms a cancer ward into a microcosm where everyone is forced to reflect on the human condition and their life choices.

scienceFiction.title: The Mysterious Island
scienceFiction.author: Jules Verne
scienceFiction.description: Five stranded prisoners must use science and creativity to survive on a mysterious island. This the dearest book of my childhood.

scienceFiction.title: The Doomed City
scienceFiction.author: Arkady and Boris Strugatsky
scienceFiction.description: In a surreal city where the sun is switched on and off artificially, people from different eras and nations participate in a mysterious Experiment. This is a darkly philosophical tale about human nature and impact of ideology.

scienceFiction.title: The Three-Body Problem Trilogy
scienceFiction.author: Liu Cixin
scienceFiction.description: Beginning during China's Cultural Revolution and spanning literally centuries, humanity faces an existential threat from an alien civilization. This is hard science fiction on a truly cosmic scale.
